greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by falling antidiagonals, where A(n,k) = sigma(A337470(n, k)).
comment: Array is read by descending antidiagonals with n >= 0 and k >= 1 ranging as: (0, 1), (0, 2), (1, 1), (0, 3), (1, 2), (2, 1), (0, 4), (1, 3), (2, 2), (3, 1), ...
link: Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to primorial numbers
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
example: The top left corner of the array begins as:
program: A337470sq(n, k) = { my(f=factor(k)); prod(i=1, #f~, Ashifted_primorial(f[i, 1], n)^f[i, 2]); };
A337472list(up_to) = { my(v = vector(1+up_to), i=0); for(a=0, oo, for(b=1, a, i++; if(i > #v, return(v)); v[i] = A337472sq(b-1, (a-(b-1))))); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 28 2020
